definitions.definition: To agree, verify or concur; to answer positively.
definitions.example: She affirmed that she would go when I asked her.

definitions.definition: To assert positively; to tell with confidence; to aver; to maintain as true.

definitions.example: They did everything they could to affirm the children's self-confidence.

definitions.definition: To make firm; to confirm, or ratify; especially to assert or confirm, as a judgment, decree, or order, brought before an appellate court for review.
